summary: Provides the foundational functionality shared by all MAPDL interface classes, managing the lifecycle of a MAPDL session, executing commands, handling logging, geometry creation, plotting, file operations, parameter validation, and environment checks.
business_intent: To serve as a central, reusable core that abstracts communication with the ANSYS MAPDL engine, enabling consistent command execution, result retrieval, and utility services across different MAPDL client implementations for automation and integration purposes.
